summary: Contractor SOP for onboarding, accepting jobs, completing work, and receiving payouts in ProBridge ABQ.

steps.text: Sign up through the ProBridge contractor portal for ABQ and provide your basic business details.
Select the service categories you are qualified for (e.g., handyman, cleaning, moving, etc.) and your typical service area in ABQ.
Submit any required verification information requested by the operator (e.g., insurance or licenses where applicable).
Monitor the contractor portal or your notifications for new job offers that match your categories and area.
For each offer, review the job description, location, date/time, and payout amount before accepting.
Accept only jobs you can reliably complete; if you cannot take the job, decline quickly so another contractor can be assigned.
Once accepted, the job status will move to 'assigned' and you will be expected to perform the work at the agreed time.
Arrive on time and confirm the scope of work with the client before starting.
If the client requests work outside the agreed scope, contact the operator before committing to significant changes.
Work safely, respect the property, and follow any relevant regulations or building rules.
After the work is finished, walk through the completed items with the client when possible.
In the contractor portal, mark the job as complete and add any notes the operator should be aware of.
If there were any issues (access problems, scope changes, safety concerns), document them in the notes for the operator.
Once a job is marked completed and payment is confirmed, the system will calculate your payout according to the current ABQ payout structure (for example, 75% of the client total for v1).
Payouts are targeted within the specified window (for example, within 24 hours of completion), depending on the configured payout method.
If a payout does not arrive within the expected window, contact the operator and reference your job ID and payout reference.
Repeated no-shows, last-minute cancellations, or serious client complaints may result in fewer job offers or removal from the platform.
Maintain professional communication and notify the operator as early as possible if issues arise.

notes: Contractors in ABQ are paid based on the agreed payout structure; platform fees are handled by ProBridge and are not charged separately to contractors.
High reliability and positive client feedback increase the likelihood of receiving more job offers.
